name: La Quinta Inn & Suites Ft Lauderdale Cypress Creek

reviews.text: This property was under renovation for my stay. While some renoviation issues were anticipated, others were confusing.
reviews.title: Good stay - some renovation issues

reviews.text: First of all, I was welcomed by friendly front desk staff and check-in was easy. The location is convenient to I-95 and there are several different restaurants and a movie theater very close to the property.
reviews.title: Liked it a lot
A Best Buy!
reviews.text: On my trip to my third-floor room I saw wet paint signs and carpet being transitioned from old to new. These are the types of things I would expect in a property under renovation and this was reinforced by the notices posted on-site. The fitness center was unavailable, but again this was understandable.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What I wasn't prepared to find was that there was dried paint on pretty much everything in the guestroom. There was paint on the lamps, table, windows, and even the bedspread. Aside from the paint the room appeared to be clean, but I was surprised that they would sell a room that was apparently mid-renovation (or would not use a dropcloth to protect the furnishings if they did).
reviews.title: Okay Hotel - Poor Location
a very enjoyable stay.
reviews.text: There was a refrigerator and microwave in the room, a table with plenty of outlets, and a comfortable bed. There was plenty of work space and free wireless internet. While the outside was warm and humid, the inside of the room was at a nice comfortable temperature when I arrived, which was certainly welcome.

This location is your typical, run-of-the-mill, hotels. I was a little disappointed with the fitness center. On a Tuesday, the treadmill did not work, nor was the water cooler cold (they are plugged into the same outlet). I reported this to management on Tuesday, that most likely, the circuit breaker needed to be reset, and by Thursday, it was still not fixed. The continental breakfast was mediocre, and the location is not very accessible. The hotel is in a decent location, but due to the cheap prices of the rooms, the clientelle is not the best. Overall, the room was clean, neat, as were the restrooms. The room did smell of smoke, and even after it was reported, still smelled of smoke. (I asked for a non-smoking room.) My first night, the TV connection was static(y), and was fixed the next day after I reported it. If you have a little more money, stay elsewhere, if not, this one will suffice.
reviews.title: Average stay
standard quality La Quinta hotel
reviews.text: We found this hotel using Hotwire. The hotel cost $40 per night + $4 tax. The hotel is located about 8 miles or so west of the beach and is about 10-12 miles away from FLL airport. The hotel is somewhat hard to find at night---the hotel needs to have a brightly lit sign in order for travellers to be able to find it.

reviews.title: La Quinta Inn Ft. Lauderdale Cypress Creek I-95
reviews.text: The room itself was nice--we had two beds and a fairly big TV set. We also had a private bathroom with a bathtub. If you have ever stayed in a La Quinta before, this room is just like all of the others. Hotwire does not guarantee that a room will have two beds. So when I purchased the room I called the hotel to request a room with two beds, and they were nice enough to give us one. The room was fairly spacious. reviews.title: Good Experience
reviews.text: We stayed for 2 nights in April of 2006 at this hotel. This is a newer hotel and the bed was comfortable and the room was quiet. The staff were friendly and courteous. The hotel has a more than adequate continental breakfast and even includes fresh waffles. Being on vacation, we would have liked to have seen the hours for the mid-week breakfasts extended. The place was very clean. It was more expensive and we received less for our money than in other areas of Florida, but we felt that the Ft. Lauderdale area as a whole is more expensive. The hotel is convenient to the Butterfly Gardens, which we enjoyed, and to the turnpike. The rooms could use a refrigerator. I enjoyed the outdoor jacuzzi pool, but I felt it could have been hotter. Even so, we enjoyed our stay.

Booked through HOTWIRE and got a good rate for 2 rooms ($52 each). Traveling with 4 pre-teens and wanted to give them their "own" room. On check in around 4pm was asked a strange Question, "Will you be needing BOTH rooms now?" "Of course" I said. Then I thought, were they thinking I wouldn't need it till midnight? It was pre-paid so check-in was quick. That's where "quick" ended. Come to find out La Quinta rooms DO NOT connect. was given 1 room on 1 end and 1 room on the other end. HMMMMM with pre-teen's at least wanted to be next door. If not for safety issues, for the fact to control any noise problems (pre-teens remember) that might distract other guests. Treck back down to try to get 2 rooms side-by-side. Was given a "sigh" from desk clerk. Guess I disrupted her smoking break. Was given 2 rooms next to each other. Only to discover someone already using in 1 of the rooms. 2nd treck back down to FD. told to go have dinner and it would be resolved by the time we returned. Returned back around 9pm and were given 2 rooms slightly closer together than the first set. Just left it and told then to behave and keep it down. There were no phone calls from the FD so I assume they listened to me. I just felt like since we weren't paying "full-price" we were treated as such. but honestly it wasn't worth the discounted price either. Sherton suites is down the street as well as Hampton Inn, they seemed like a better option.
reviews.title: Pass This One by

reviews.text: This is a fairly decent hotel, thanks to recent renovations after Hurricane Wilma last fall. The rooms are clean and of average size. The wireless Internet connection is free and easy to connect to. The drinks in the vending machine are reasonably priced at $1.25. The location is a couple of blocks off of I-95. McDonald's, Wendy's, Arby's, Subway and Chili's are within walking distance, with several other restaurants and a movie theater about a quarter of a mile away. The complimentary continental breakfast is filling, but nothing outstanding.
reviews.title: Decent accomodations, but overpriced
Average Stay
reviews.text: The price (possibly inflated due to Spring Break time) was high at $118.00 per night, plus about $15 in taxes for a king size bed with couch. This was with a AAA discount. Prices last fall were in the $75-80 range. The carpet in the hallway has many stains (something you would expect to be replaced). There were cigarette butts and fast food trash littering the stairwells. Exiting the parking lot onto Powerline requires you to drive through the parking lot of a tire store. Exiting onto Cypress Creek requires you to go west and make a U-turn on a very busy road.

Yes, the hotel is still recovering from Hurricane Wilma. Yes, there are still some rooms that are unavailable because of roof damage. All in all, the hotel was clean, the room was average size & clean, the front desk staff was friendly. It was fairly easy to find, but finding a Walgreens or similar store was difficult.
reviews.title: Still recovering from storm
